topic.title: What's the relationship between TokenScript and Ethereum's Contract Metadata?

body.p: In Ethereum, Contract Metadata is a JSON file generated by the contract's compiler that contains ABI and NatSpec, both Ethereum smart contract concepts.
Contract Metdata contains developer information on how to write software that talks to the contract. TokenScript is a type of software that talks to contracts.

section.title: TokenScript is about Token
section.p: Sometimes people describe TokenScript as a contract's user interface, and since Contract Metadata and TokenScript as they are both "about contract" they might be comparable. But TokenScript is better described as a token's interface.

For a website builder or an app builder, the contracts behind a token are abstracted away. This is evident when the numbers of contracts and the numbers of Tokens are not the same. For example, a AAVE token works by accessing 2 contracts. A website builder who uses TokenScript never need to know how many contracts are there at work and what are these interfaces. They only need to care about the functionalities provided by the token.
It's also possible to define a token without referring to any smart contract (0 contracts). Such TokenScript is only possible with .
